com.jfilegoodies.explorer

Class FileExplorer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jfilegoodies.explorer.FileExplorer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileExplorers.LazyExplorer, LinuxFileExplorer, MacFileExplorer, WindowsFileExplorer

    public abstract class FileExplorer
extends java.lang.Object
    A FileExplorer represents the GUI file-explorer provided by the OS.

    The FileExplorer itself is an abstract structure because file-explorers work differently on each OS.

    You can use FileExplorers.get() to create the right implementation that works on the current operating system.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Daniel Gyorffy
    See Also:
    FileExplorers

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public boolean open()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the gui file-explorer.

        Note: On Linux, 'nautilus' should be installed on the system (if it's not by default) sudo apt install nautilus

        Returns:
        true if the window opened; false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if some I/O exception occurs
        Since:
        1.0

      • openDir

        public boolean openDir(java.io.File file)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the gui file-explorer window where the specified directory is opened.

        If the specified File doesn't exist or it is not a directory then it will immediately return with false.

        Parameters:
        file - the file object that represents the directory; may be null (then the method will immediately return)
        Returns:
        true if the window is opened; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if some I/O exception occurs
        Since:
        1.0

      • openSelect

        public boolean openSelect(java.io.File file)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the gui file-explorer window where the specified file is selected.

        If the file doesn't exist then it will immediately return with false.

        Note: On Linux, 'nautilus' should be installed on the system (if it's not by default) sudo apt install nautilus

        Parameters:
        file - the file object that represents the file or directory; may be null (then the method will immediately return)
        Returns:
        true if the window is opened; false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if some I/O exception occurs
        Since:
        1.0
